body: Without the nuke consul PR I failed at the consul deployment phase which seems to require sudo - not going to bother debugging this and instead will wait for that PR to be merged.
going to close in favor of #2524.
@lionelvillard do we need to add this to the docs https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/pull/2440#issuecomment-312435272?
@mdeuser, please review.
@dubeejw shall we put those in a separate file?

activation for triggers and rules have end time stamp equal to 0 and duration 0 as well.
a rule will have a caused field also populated.

isn't there a pr that almost has this completed?
See https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/pull/2138.
Sure, can move the negative config tests to a different file.

@rabbah I added this to the doc: https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/pull/2524/commits/0ff4400512cda733b0397e5f6f5771cb177ce999#diff-5a5d069dcad99a9f8109ac77d1b9860cR258

I think that's the proper way when using `brew`

When authenticating with just the cert, can the namespace property value still be "_"? Possibly related to a discussion thread above..

Answer: @mdeuser ,can the namespace property value still be "_"?What's mean for this? i have replied above, may be
exist your answer there.

@mdeuser 
What is the expected behavior when both the authkey and cert property values are set?

answer:
Only set --auth or (--cert and --key), it both set, it will report error

if set `ssl_verify_client=on`, only support client certificate verification.
if set `ssl_verify_client=off`, only support auth key verfification.
@markusthoemmes do we need a Jenkins build for this?
Not anymore, rebase and Travis is sufficient.
@rabbah I just tested this PR and it worked ðŸŽ‰ ðŸŽ‰ ðŸŽ‰ ðŸŽ‰ ðŸŽ‰

I found another dependency for this PR:
on generating the whisk.properties, two lists are generated. One with all controllers and one with all invokers.
On using these aliases, the list only contains the list of the aliases, but the IPs or hostnames are needed for the tests.

I found the following line in the internet: `controller.hosts={{ groups["controllers"] | map('extract', hostvars, 'ansible_host') | list | join(",") }}`
But on using this one, it does not work when using no aliases.
We should have a deeper look here.

@rabbah @mdeuser , i have modified the codes. please review.
The changes logic is that pass namespace by http header from wsk to controller, because namesapce + `CN`(it is subject) can determine a unique Identity, so it works well.

@rabbah, @mdeuser - wasn't able to find an open PR for this issue when we originally looked into it. Thanks for pointing that out! Are we to assume that this issue is off the table, then? It doesn't look like the PR has been touched in a few months.
This issue is still in need of an implementation.  Since the original owner of that PR is not working on it, you can pick up where it leaves off.

@mdeuser, @rabbah, @dubeejw: we wanted to get some feedback on our current proposed output for `wsk activation list`:
```
$ wsk activation list
activations
activation id                     name            type     date        start     end       zone  duration  status
0dde2068e2db439883ccdfad79252c11  goodbye         action   2017-07-27  10:13:02  10:13:02  EDT   42        success
e03b8069ed7541aabd213a47ec76aaa6  goodbyeRule     rule     2017-07-27  10:13:02  n/a       EDT   0         success
50aa984ff20c4f9a8cf64dc92e94fff5  goodbyeTrigger  trigger  2017-07-27  10:13:02  n/a       EDT   0         success
aa7627f3addb42c2a1c80837a218849c  hello           action   2017-07-27  09:52:20  09:52:20  EDT   371       success
4ab5887c564c4b46b8dc688000dcd121  hello           action   2017-07-27  09:52:19  09:52:19  EDT   68        success
20297150a8794bc2904d6786bef933b2  hello           action   2017-07-27  09:52:19  09:52:19  EDT   76        success
7fc8cc98eafa44c488f986ce38d5b0a2  zhelloRule      rule     2017-07-27  09:52:19  n/a       EDT   0         success
f639be4f00ab457f9065c38eab337ded  ahelloRule      rule     2017-07-27  09:52:19  n/a       EDT   0         success
667cc6023e3647668c12be8117a7d98e  helloRule       rule     2017-07-27  09:52:19  n/a       EDT   0         success
```
for triggers and rules i would omit the end and duration. otherwise looks good to me.

i'm confused by the time zone - where would there be different time zones for the actions? you're going to show the stamps in the time zone for the local host machine right? i think EDT/EST there is a unnecessarily confusing. I would take it out.
could we make wskadmin fail if it tries to add a namespace to a blocked subject?
PG3 925 ðŸ”µ
PG1 1856 ðŸ”µ

By default, no hiding of any output is done by this PR.  Only if the caller supplies filtering strings will filtering take place.  Setting the `showCmd` flag on it's own will continue to display the output.  Individual tests can leverage this facility or not.
i'm suggesting that any test that has show cmd = true is likely a mistake for CI and should be turned off; do you see a reason we want to show the cmd under ci?
@keunseob can you rebase this to master to pick up the latest changes then travis can verify your changes and we can merge.

looking good.
- are the size limits for the `name` column?
- will `name` value include the package?
- what is driving the `zone` column?  i agree with @rabbah in that the default date/time should be displayed in the local system executing the cli.
- `duration` .. add units to column header.. i.e. `duration (ms)`
i guess i'm suggesting that the discussion of whether or not a test uses the showCmd flag be considered outside this pr.  by default the showCmd flag is false.

ok then i'm confused - if we agree (and i thought we did) that show cmd is useful for debugging then we should not hide strings in those commands (instead hide the strings in the with clue error message only).

so i suggest backing out the change for the `if (showCmd) ...` bit.
if then there's a concern that there are tests which show the cmd and hence printing sensitive info, all of those instances should be turned to off.

if you want a second pr to turn off all instances of show cmd, fine. but i would still remove the change for showCmd.

This is more of an error related to https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/issues/32 - the deployment should not require you to run `wskdev edge` as it already does that.

perhaps this is better left for a "trouble shooting" section of the docs.
So fixed all commented portions except the long name problem, but thats being taken care of in #2484 .   @dubeejw ^^ PG1/1854
#2530 should be merged first, the first commit is taken from there to prevent merge conflicts.

Any opinions on format for the date(yyyy-mm-dd)? There is no Golang function that allows us to format the date based on location. So, if we wanted to format the date according to region we would have to write something to check the users region.

@mdeuser 
1) Currently, there are no limits for name.
2) Name does not include package.
3) We agree, zone is being removed.
4) Will do.
@jessealva, looks like you have a lot of commits here from upstream master that shouldn't be listed.

@ddragosd 
Sure, I'm going to test it locally and on our load test environment. 
The plan is to stress 3 node cluster under a high load, and look how akka behaves under the burst. 
I'm also planning to test whether the cluster is still functioning in case of node failure (-s). 
The next tests would be to measure the maximal number of nodes in the cluster with an acceptable performance.
@csantanapr there are still references to port 4243 after this pr; is the goal to remove all those?

```
git fetch --all --prune
git rebase upstream/master
```

is your friend :)
avoid merge commits and check out the git guide for more tips. https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/wiki/Contributing:-Git-guidelines

@jeremiaswerner @markusthoemmes why do we have ansible privilege escalation? https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=become+&type=

i'd like to remove it all (if it's truly needed for some deployments, then i can guard it so it's not enable for local development)

Thinking about the appearance of and activation that spans midnight and crosses into the next day.  having a  `start` and `end` each complete with date/time would work, but may be too wordy as most activations would start/end on the same date.  are the `start` and `end` time values in 24 hour format?

git blames for the becomes point to many fingers - i'm wondering if we really need these.
perhaps in some environments it might be required, in which case i'd exempt all local deployments if possible.
They are on military time, yes.
As for date, i think YYYY-MM-DD should be fine for now.

ok.  hide is removed from the showCmd output.

pg1/926

Some development items to consider
- CLI Go code
  - Removal of experimental command, associated help, associated wski18n strings
  - Replacement of `V2` labeled structures and functions.  i.e. `apiCreateCmdV2` becomes just `apiCreateCmd` after removing the existing experimental `apiCreateCmd`.  Look in go-whisk/whisk/api.go and go-whisk-cli/commands/api.go
- Tests
  - ApiGwRoutemgmtActionTests
    - Removal `experimental` functions.
    - Re-label the `V2` items (remove V2) - methods, test labels, etc.
    - Delete the entire `API Gateway routemgmt action parameter validation` test suite
  - ApiGwTests
    - Remove all experimental tests and helper functions
  - ApiGwEndToEndTests
    - Remove api-experimental test suite
- Deployment
  - installRouteMgmt.sh task.  Remove installation of routemgmt package and associated actions
related changes in https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk/pull/2493 feel free to pick it up.

Fixed, @dubeejw

not totally sure what to do about routemgmt, do you want me to remove the entire routemgmt.yml?

Here are our two competing ideas for list output, given feedback:
Output 1:
```
$ wsk activation list
activations
activation id                     name                                                type     start                 end              duration      status
8be7b9b23749477dbd9d0a21ddadec34  thisisareallyreallyreallyreallyREALLYreallylong...  action   2017/07/27  12:45:40  07/27  12:45:40  34h 17m 36s   success
```

The only difference is how we list the duration.
Also, here is a link showing the specific function for and display of each duration: https://play.golang.org/p/--95pS7LYG
Any feedback about which direction to go would be appreciated. Thanks!
no, the routemgmt.yml stays - along with the entire ansible role `routemgmt`.  the only change to this role is the update to the `installRouteMgmt.sh` file under that role.
what are the duration units?  action have a maximum duration of minutes.. currently 5 tops before they are automatically booted from the system.
imho, the date formats using dash (-) delimiters are more readable.  i think just a single date probably warranted.  maybe `start date`, `start time`, `end time`.

PG3 928 ðŸ”µ

@mdeuser, @rabbah: how does this look? We adjusted the duration back to reporting just milliseconds, as a 5 minute max run time isn't too much to account for, in our opinion. Also changed the delimiter back to dashes, as well as adjusted the headers and took out the end date.
```
$ wsk activation list
activations
activation id                     name                                                type     start date  start time  end time  duration (ms)  status
8be7b9b23749477dbd9d0a21ddadec34  thisisareallyreallyreallyreallyREALLYreallylong...  action   2017-07-27  12:45:40    12:45:40  44             success
8ac78624eb654b1cb9442ec62686a9f6  hello                                               action   2017-07-27  12:08:48    12:08:48  48             success
d0083e7c387b4dbcbd66bf303a4771f8  hello                                               action   2017-07-27  12:08:48    12:08:48  7              success
9c8636e15bcc4c129f226e422737610f  hello                                               action   2017-07-27  12:08:48    12:08:48  60             success
6d17d52fd40f4ba38f3d0125bf7c9cd1  zhelloRule                                          rule     2017-07-27  12:08:48    --:--:--  -              success
2faeafa6ec7c495a984124f43ffedbb4  ahelloRule                                          rule     2017-07-27  12:08:48    --:--:--  -              success
b7d8b40eb473467c88dbc1710d5fdc7a  helloRule                                           rule     2017-07-27  12:08:48    --:--:--  -              success
ed5fc08691974db0b5e1ee155c216ba6  helloTrigger                                        trigger  2017-07-27  12:08:48    --:--:--  -              success
c0e392579fc4404596e2cc18fc9f3c73  hello                                               action   2017-07-27  12:08:17    12:08:17  41             success
```

looks good!
- Is the name field is now being bounded?  If so, that's good, but we'll need a --full flag to display this information vertically (see `wsk api list --full`) so that the entire name can be displayed
- The package name should also be included if it's not the default user package - to handle the case of the same named action residing in separate packages.
- Personally, I like having numbers, like the duration, being right aligned.  That way the digits will always line up across the rows.

@mdeuser - with regards to a `--full` flag, do you want us to overwrite the current method that `wsk activation list --full` uses? Right now, it spits out the raw json file documenting all pertinent information for each activation in the list.

ah.. yes.  the command already has that `--full` support.  that should be good enough.

does the backend need a change to support the package qualification?
still had to resolve a conflict - will wait for travis.

@mdeuser 
- Quick note about the `--full` list: the information in the json format is not currently formatted in a necessarily human-friendly way when it comes to time. Here is an example of what it might look like if we still pursued the full list you were discussing:
```
$ wsk activation list
activations
Activation: 3134aa36e0cb458dbf11210afffa7c83
   Name: hello
   Type: action
   Start Date: 2017-07-28
   Start Time: 09:01:03
   End Time: 09:01:03
   Duration (ms): 79
   Status: success
Activation: 8be7b9b23749477dbd9d0a21ddadec34
   Name: thisisareallyreallyreallyreallyREALLYreallylongactionname
   Type: action
   Start Date: 2017-07-27
   Start Time: 12:45:40
   End Time: 12:45:40
   Duration (ms): 44
   Status: success
```
Also of note: API full list used to be printed out in JSON format, but has since been changed to the way `wsk api list -f` prints now, as you had suggested we look into. Not sure if this might be in some other issue?

- With regards to changing the back end: we are unsure. The json output has a `path` value under annotations that includes the package name, and it seems easy to grab the `packageName/entityName` from it. We're not sure if it's better to use that information to create the name, or to change the backend to give us the name beforehand. Thoughts?

Haha, that last update had me scratching my head a bit, until i realized i had an iterator and my second check was looking for text the iterator had already past when doing the first check.  Changed the checks to so they are done in the order in which the strings they are looking for are printed and everything was fine again.

Controller's and Invoker's Kafka version are now pulled from a common place. I don't think we can build Kafka from the same version file since the tag feature for the image to pull is to new. Here is the PR that added it [Docker PR](https://github.com/moby/moby/pull/31352/commits). We would need to update the Docker version to 1.13+
If privilege escalation is needed, one can recover this with `ansible-playbook --become-user=root`.
Another alternative is the effective user running the `ansible-playbook` can have the high privilege, I vote not to have the privilege inside the scripts.

@rabbah, @mdeuser, @dubeejw : I have a suggested change for Alphabetize. 

Currently, to order alphabetically, we use the order flag as a bool: `wsk action list --order`. However, with APIs in particular, you have to qualify if you want to sort by action name, or by `Base path`/`Rel path`/`Verb`. This means an additional flag: either something like `wsk api list --order --orderAction`, or `wsk api list --orderAction` for action names, and `wsk api list --order` for the normal sorting. 

We think we can get more mileage out of passing a string through the `--order` flag instead of it being a bool. Example: `wsk api list --order Alpha` or `wsk api list --order A` to sort alphabetically the usual way, versus `wsk api list --order AlphaAction` or `wsk api list --order N` to sort alphabetically by action name. 

What were your thoughts on this? In particular: is this a good idea, and if so, what proper naming convention should we set? This could be beneficial later on to have this in place when we want to expand how users could sort a list.
Wasn't there some discussion about making alpha the default and using -t to order by time?
